WorkItem.Description:
Using the DataGrid that comes with .NET 4.0 I am experiencing that it will sometimes display the row header when row headers has been turned off (see the attached image).
 
Given a set of customers, here's the XAML that produced the grid, the screenshot of the upper left corner shows the third row showing it's row header. Subsequently all columns are shifted to the right by the row header width. I can tell this is a row header as hovering shows it's the button.
 
    <DataGrid Name="gridCustomers"
                ItemsSource="{Binding Path=Customers}"
                SelectedIndex="{Binding SelectedIndex}"
                SelectedItem="{Binding SelectedCustomer}"
                AutoGenerateColumns="False"
                CanUserAddRows="False"
                CanUserDeleteRows="False"
                CanUserReorderColumns="True"
                CanUserSortColumns="True"
                CanUserResizeRows="False"
                IsReadOnly="True"
                HeadersVisibility="Column"
                SelectionMode="Single"
                Sorting="DoSortCustomers"
                SelectionUnit="FullRow">
        <DataGrid.Columns>
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="Customer" Binding="{Binding ID}" />
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="Name" Binding="{Binding Name}" />
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="Customer Type" Binding="{Binding CustomerType.Name}" />
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="Address 1" Binding="{Binding Address1}" />
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="Suburb" Binding="{Binding Suburb}" />
            <DataGridTextColumn Header="State" Binding="{Binding State}" />
        </DataGrid.Columns>
    </DataGrid>
WorkItem.Summary: DataGrid with row headers turned off shows row header for some rows

Comments.Message: The same bug occures in latest WPF Toolkit with .NET 3.5. Additionally, if there is a column in the grid displaying a datetime item, for rows where the row header appears, the formatting of the datetime string is changed to english format, eventhough all other datetime cells (on rows without header) are displayed using the local date and time format.

Same here in .NET 4.0. 

Solution: RowHeaderWidth = 0

More proof see here

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8683631/wpf-datagrid-row-header-visibility-error
